Type of organisation:
"Profit with purpose" - For-profit app which generates 
revenue by selling the video streams from clients to 
other companies (Microsoft)
Type of app/uses of app:
Human centred help
Navigation
Object detection
Owners:
Founder: Hans Jorgen Wiberg
CEO: Mike Buckley
Extra notes:
A seperate website holds all the information about the team, making it hard to find out about them. 

They are SOC 2 compliant which requires an independent auditor to evaluate their security

The status website displays if any incidents happpen, when they happened, and a brief description of what happend.
Compliance/Audits:
GDPR
SOC 2 Type I
With a SOC Type II examination underway
CCPA

Type of organisation: Startup/SME
Type of app/uses of app:
AI centred help
Object detection (including personal items)
Owners: Founders: Stéphanie, Thomas
Extra notes:
There is an option to allow images to be transmitted to a third-party OpenAI service.
Doesn't transfer Personal Data outside the EU direclty (although the personal data may end up being processed by servers outside the EU

Navigation

Type of organisation:
Open source free app.
Part of the OCCaM Lab projects (run by Paul)

company

For-profit

Type of organisation:
For-profit.
Generates money by having a subscription based

of minutes per month.

AI and human help.
Description of images (AI)
Help with current situation (human)

Aira Tech Corp.
(Which "Blue Diego Investment Group" 
acquisitioned in 2020)

Type of organisation:
AYES was startup, app used subscription model.
Synapse ITS is for-profit, removed subscriptions.
Synapse ITS has had one round of private funding.

Polaras Enterprises is a for-profit company which was
also acquired by Synapse ITS
Type of app/uses of app:
AI centred help.
Navigation 
(specifically pedestrian road signs)
Owners:
Started by AYES, but got acquired by 
Synapse ITS in 2025. Now it is developed by the 
company Polara Enterprises which is also owned 
by Synapse ITS
Initial release:
2021 
(AYES is created, app released same year)
2025 
(AYES is acquired, subscription is removed)
Extra notes:
Hard to find either companies details
Claims to work completely offline.
AYES website no longer works.

Type of organisation: Startup which has turned gone into VC. For-profit, makes money by improving accessibility for companies such as zoos, aquariums, airports, etc.
Type of app/uses of app: Allows partially sighted people make the most of their sight, allows the user to modify certain aspects of their camera feed (such as colour, zoom, etc) to make it easier to see
Owners:
Founder: Rebecca Rosenberg
Funded by: Techstars_, John Hopkins Technology Ventures, TEDCO, Morgan Stanley

Type of organisation: Private company, has 9 investors with a mix of government, corporation, and accelerators
Type of app/uses of app: AI based help. Three related products: Jyoti AI (AI powered smart glasses and app), Jyoti AI Pro (enhanced version of Jyoti AI, with offline object detection, and audio feedback), Jyoti AI Reader (desk camera which reads printed material in multiple languages)
Owners: Developed by Torch It
Initial release:
2024 (Jyoti app is released)
2016 (Torch It is founded)
Extra notes:
In the privacy policy, Torch It says they will share data with donor-beneficiary platforms (opt-in)
Smart glasses camera is easily visible (compared to other smart glasses like the meta Ray-Bans)
